name: Market capitalisation indicator
description:
Market capitalisation indicator classifies the Listed central bank and private sectory company as Large or Small market capitalisation. 

Market capitalisation, or "market cap", of the Listed central bank and private sector company is the sum of the market capitalisations based on the market value of the total outstanding shares issued by the same listed legal entity or a group of legal entities across all stock markets globally, where the total outstanding shares issued by the group of legal entities refer to cases where the listed entity is a parent company of a group of legal entities.
Large market cap is defined as a market capitalisation equal to or greater than USD 2 billion and small market cap is defined as a market capitalisation of less than USD 2 billion.
(https://www.bis.org/basel_framework/chapter/MAR/21.htm?inforce=20230101&published=20200327)
